intro: Aristida ternipes, commonly known as the three-awn grass, is a perennial grass species native to the Americas. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. The plant has slender,丛生 stems and produces fluffy, three-awned inflorescences that are characteristic of the genus. Its leaves are narrow and pointed, with a rough texture. Aristida ternipes is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife.
